 David G Schultenover Knitting is a method of making fabric by looping yarns around each other using one or more knitting needles . Knitting involves looping around yarns using knitting needles to make fabric .
 Much of the clothing we wear is made by knitting, including sweaters, stockings, scarfs, and hats . Knitting is a form of art form .
 Knitted clothes are popular because they can stretch, then return to their original shape . Knitted clothing is popular because it can stretch and then return .
 A knitted fabric can be formed to create such items as wallhangings and stuffed fiber sculpture . The fiber sculpture can be used to create wallhanging or stuffed fiber sculptures .
 Knitting can also decorate other fiber forms made by crocheting, macramé, and weaving . Knitting is also a way of decorating other fibers made by other fibers .
 One end is pointed, and the other end has a knob to prevent the fabric from slipping off . The other end is a knob that prevents the fabric slipping off, and is pointed .
 Today, knitting needles have smooth tips and are generally made of aluminum, wood, or plastic . Knicker needles are made of aluminium, wood or plastic and generally made from aluminum .
 The thickness of the needles and the type of yarn can be varied according to the nature of the fabric desired . The thickness and type of the yarn can also be varied depending on the fabric .
 Slender needles and lightweight yarn may be chosen for a delicate knit . The delicate knit is a delicate choice of needles and yarn .
 Wool has been the traditional yarn for knitting, but cotton, silk, and synthetics such as acrylic have also become popular . Cotton, silk and synthetic yarns are also popular .

 A knitter usually makes a sample about 3 inches (8 centimeters) square to determine the gauge . The knitter typically makes a small sample of the yarn to determine a gauge .
 The gauge is the exact number of stitches and rows per inch produced by the needles, yarn, and type of stitch . The exact number and rows of stitches per inch is the number and length of each stitch .
 Knowing the gauge is essential when sizes are required for clothing because each persons hand-knitting differs in tension . Each person hand knickerknitting is different in tension.
 If the knitted sample does not match the pattern gauge, the knitter must either change the needle size or the thickness of the yarn . If the pattern is not met, it must be changed to match the gauge .
 If the gauge measure is too small, a larger needle or a thicker yarn needs to be used . If the needle or yarn is too thin, a thicker needle or thicker yarn is needed .

 The Northwestern Plain stretches along the entire western coast of North Korea . North Korea is located on the Northwestern Plain .

 Seasonal winds called monsoons affect Korea's weather throughout the year . The Korean weather is affected by monsoon winds, known as monsoon rains .
 A monsoon blows in from the south and southeast during the summer, bringing hot, humid weather . The monsoon is a powerful, humid, unpredictable weather system .
 A cold, dry monsoon blows in from the north and northwest during the winter, bringing cold weather . The cold monsoon winds in from north and west, bringing the cold weather in some areas .
 Korea's massive mountains protect the peninsula's east coast from the winter monsoon . South Korea's mountains are protected by the mountains .

 16 UN countries sent troops to help the South Koreans . 41 countries sent military equipment or food and other supplies .
 The United States provided about 90 percent of the troops, military equipment, and supplies that were sent to South Korea . The U.S. provided most troops, equipment and supplies .
 China fought on the side of North Korea, and the Soviet Union gave military equipment to the North Koreans . China fought against North Korea .
 The Korean War ended on July 27, 1953, when the UN and North Korea signed an armistice agreement . North Korea and the UN signed a cease-fire agreement in July 1953 .
 A permanent peace treaty between South Korea and North Korea has never been signed . The Koreas have never been able to sign a peace treaty .
 U.S. military forces remain in South Korea to discourage a resumption of hostilities between the two parts of Korea .
 About a million South Korean civilians were killed, and several million made homeless . Several million were made homeless during the Korean invasion .
 The Japanese gained control of Korea in 1895 and made it part of Japan in 1910 . It was made part of the country in 1910 and is now Japan .
 Allies defeated Japan in World War II . U.S. and Soviet forces moved into Korea in Korea in 1950s .
 After the war, Soviet troops occupied Korea north of the 38th parallel of north latitude . The imaginary line cuts the country about in half .
 UN General Assembly declared that elections should be held throughout Korea to choose one government for the entire country . In 1947, the UN declared that the elections should take place to choose a government for Korea .
 The Soviet Union opposed this idea and would not permit elections in North Korea . North Korea was ruled out of elections by the West .
 On May 10, 1948, the people of South Korea elected a legislature, the National Assembly . The National Assembly is the South Korean parliament . South Korea is one of the largest economies in the world .
 North Korean Communists established the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea on September 9 . North Korea was established by North Korea Communists in 1953 .
 Both North and South Korea claimed the entire country, and their troops clashed near the border several times from 1948 to 1950 . Both countries claimed the territory, and the border was disputed by both .
 The United States removed its last troops from Korea in 1949 and indicated early in 1950 that Korea lay outside the main United States defense line in Asia . The U.S. removed its final troops from the Korean Peninsula in 1949 .
 When North Korea invaded South Korea, the North Korean Army had about 135,000 soldiers . The North Korea invasion was the first invasion of the Korean peninsula in decades .
 Many of the soldiers had fought for China and the Soviet Union during World War I. Many of them had fought in China and Soviet Union . The soldiers were killed in the battle .
 The South Korean Army had about 95,000 soldiers, few planes or heavy guns, and no tanks . South Korea had few planes and few tanks, and had few tanks .
 At first, the South Korean Army put up little resistance to the enemy attack . The South Korean army put up . little resistance . The North Korean government has been unable to defend itself .
 U.N. troops from 16 countries fought Communist troops during the Korean War . U.S. troops fought Communist forces during the war .

 The UN Security Council issued a resolution demanding that the Communists stop fighting and retreat to the 38th parallel . The resolution was issued on the day the war began, the day of the war .
 The Soviet Union, a member of the 11-nation Council, could have vetoed the resolution . It is not clear whether the Soviet Union would have vetoed it .
 Soviet Union was boycotting Council meetings to protest Nationalist China's membership on the Council, and the Soviet delegate November 1950 to January 1951 2 .
 Parailel Yellow Sea was absent when the vote on Korea was taken . UN advance and armistice January 1951 to July 1953 . UN TROOP VACUATIONS .
 North Korea ignored the UN demand, and on June 27 its troops reached the outskirts of Seoul, the South Korean capital . On June 27, the North Korean army crossed the border with South Korea's capital .
 President Harry S Truman and the UN took action to try to halt the Communist advance . That same day, both President Harry and UN tried to take action to stop the advance .
 Truman ordered United States air and naval forces to South Korea . UN asked its members to aid South Korea. Truman ordered U.S. forces to help South Korea and the UN asked for help .
 Congress supported Truman's actions and the UN’s policy, but did not formally declare war against North Korea . Congress supported the UN's policy but not formally declared war .
 On July 1, part of the U.S. Army 24th Infantry Division flew from Japan to Pusan at the southern tip of Korea .
 The next day, these troops began to move into battle positions near Taejon, about 75 miles south of Seoul . The South Korean capital is located in the region .
 Troops from other UN nations began arriving in Korea shortly after the Americans . Troops began arriving shortly after they arrived in Korea .
 On July 8, with the approval of the UN Security Council, Truman named General Douglas MacArthur commander in chief of the U.N. Command . MacArthur was the first president of the United Nations Command in 1945 . He was named by Truman on July 8 .
 Command had authority over all the Allies—South Koreans, Americans, and other UN troops from other UN countries . Command was in charge of South Korea, the U.S. and other Allies .
 MacArthur directed Allied operations from his headquarters in Tokyo, Japan, during the Battle of the World War One .
 Lieutenant General Walton H Walker, head of the United States Eighth Army, became field commander of the Allied ground forces in Korea . On July 13, Lieutenant General Walker became the field commander in Korea.
 Units of the U.S. Army 1st Cavalry Division and 25th Infantry Division landed in Korea on July 19 to aid the outnumbered soldiers of the 24th Division . Units landed in South Korea to help the outnumbered 24th division .
 The United States 1st Marine Provisional Brigade and the 2nd Infantry Division of the Army arrived in South Korea in late July . The U.S. Army and Marine Corps arrived in the country in July .
 The Pusan Perimeter was a battle line in the southeast corner of South Korea . It was formed in the 1950s and 1960s .
 It extended roughly from the city of Pohang on the southeast coast, west around Taegu, and south and southeast nearly to Pusan . It was also located in Taegu and the east of the peninsula .
 The North Koreans lost about 58,000 soldiers and much equipment while advancing to the area . North Korea lost about 60,000 troops and equipment during the advance to the region .
 The rapid growth of American military strength gave General Walker flexibility in the use of his troops . General Walker was able to use his troops in the U.S. military .
 North Korea tried to break through the perimeter by making scattered attacks along it . North Korea has made scattered attacks on the perimeter of the border .
 Walker reacted by using reserves to meet each enemy thrust, keeping his main defense line intact . Walker reacted to each thrust with reserves .
 Overhead, United States planes provided air support and fired at the long enemy supply lines . The U.S. was involved in the battle .
 More American tanks and artillery have arrived at Pusan to strengthen the defense of the perimeter . The U.S. military says more tanks have been deployed to bolster the perimeter of the Korean peninsula .
 North Korea saw that the Allies were gaining military superiority . The North Koreans saw that they had gained military superiority. The Allies were winning military superiority in North Korea .
 They mounted a major attack and succeeded in crossing the Naktong River on August 6 . The North Korean government has been unable to find out what happened .
 United States marines and Army forces counterattacked and prevented a general breakthrough . The U.S. Marines and Army troops counterattack and prevent a major breakthrough .
 The North Koreans advanced to within shelling distance of Taegu, but major losses of troops and equipment forced them to pull back on August 25 . The North Korea pulled back from Taegu after major losses .
 The Allies halted the enemy advance on September 8 . They captured Pohang three days later, but the Allies halted it on September 9 .
 The Inchon landing was a surprise move that changed the course of the war . The landing was the first time the U.S. invaded Korea in 1944 .
 In mid-September 1950, soldiers of the United States X Corps, accompanied by United States marines, sailed from Japan to Inchon, on the northwest coast of South Korea . Soldiers of the U.S. X Corps were accompanied by marines .
 Each boat had to land at high tide because any boat near the shore when the tide dropped would be trapped in mud . Each boat would have to land in high tide to avoid being trapped by mud .
 The troops who landed at Inchon cut off the North Koreans in the Pusan Perimeter area from those north . The troops cut off North Korea in the area from the north of the border .
 X Corps moves toward Seoul, 24 miles (39 kilometers) northeast of Inchon . Commanded by Major General Edward M Almond, the X Corps moved toward Seoul .
 Seoul was captured on September 26 . President Kim Jong-won visited the area near Inchon and Seoul . He and his aides inspected the area after landing .
 General Walker's troops fought their way out of the Pusan Perimeter, inflicting heavy losses on the enemy . Meanwhile, General Walker’s troops suffered heavy losses .
 MacArthur broadcast a demand for surrender, but North Korea rejected it . MacArthur broadcast the demand, but it was rejected by North Korea . North Korea refused to surrender .
 South Korean troops crossed into North Korea on October 1 . They captured the coastal cities of Wonsan, Hungnam, and Hamhung . South Korean forces crossed into the North Korean border .
 Eighth Army troops reached North Korea on October 8 and drove the North Koreans toward Pyongyang, the capital . The Eighth Army forces were deployed to North Korea from October 8 .
 Pyongyang captured on October 19, and the Communists retreated farther north . North Korea captured Pyongyang, North Korea's capital .
 Eighth Army marched through northwestern Korea toward the Yalu River, the border between North Korea and China . The Eighth Army is on its way to the border with China .
 General MacArthur hoped to end the war before winter set in, but ordered the Allies to press on . General MacArthur, hoping to end it before winter, ordered the Allied forces to press ahead .
 United States and Chinese troops first clashed on October 25, near the Changjin Reservoir and at Onjong, near Pukchin . U.S. and Chinese forces first clashed in October 25 .
 MacArthur and his sources of information underestimated the size of the Chinese armies . MacArthur underestimated the Chinese army's strength, according to sources .
 Chinese troops crossed into North Korea in October and November . More than 300,000 Chinese troops cross into North Korean territory .
 MacArthur believed the Allied forces outnumbered the Chinese and that the Chinese would be used for defense only . MacArthur believed that the Japanese would be only used to defend only .
 Allied air power could prevent additional Chinese troops from entering North Korea, he said . Allied air force could prevent more Chinese troops entering the country, he added .
 Political leaders in Washington and most of the Allied commanders shared MacArthur's confidence that the war would be over by Christmas . MacArthur: "I believe the war will be over within a few days"
 China sent a huge force against the Allies on November 26 and 27 and forced them to retreat . The Allies were forced to retreat from China .
 By the end of November, the Communists had driven a wedge between Eighth Army troops in the west and the X Corps in the east . The Communists drove the wedge between the Eighth and X Corps .
 20,000 U.S. marines and infantrymen, surrounded by Chinese, retreat from the Changjin Reservoir to the port of Hungnam . Four days later, the United States began a historic retreat . The retreat was a retreat from Changjin reservoir to Hungnam.
 By Christmas Eve, 105,000 U.S. and Korean troops, 91,000 refugees, and 17,500 vehicles had been evacuated by sea from Hungnam . The evacuation was the largest operation in the history of the Korean peninsula .
 In the west, the Communists crossed into South Korea and captured Korangpo, 28 miles from Seoul . In the east, the Communist Party captured Koreangpo and captured the city .
 General Walker was killed in a jeep accident . Lieutenant General Matthew B Ridgway took command of the Eighth Army on December 27 . General Walker took command in December .
 The Communists began to attack Seoul on New Year's Eve, and they occupied the city on Jan. 27, 1951 . Seoul was occupied by the Communists in 1951 .
 The Allies dug in about 25 miles south on January 10, and their retreat ended . The Allies are now in control of the U.S.
 Ridgway quickly restored the confidence of the Allied troops, and they soon inflicted heavy losses on the enemy . Ridgways restored the morale of the Allies, and the enemy soon died .
 Ridgway used a new tactic calling for slower advances that would wipe out all enemy forces instead of by-passing some . Ridgways used the tactic to wipe out enemy forces rather than bypassing some forces .
 The two sides dug in and began fighting along a battle line north of the 38th parallel . The battle line began in the early 1940s .
 Neither side made important advances, but they fought many bitter battles for strategic positions . Neither side fought important battles for either side, but fought for strategic gains .
 Battlefields included Bloody Ridge, Finger Ridge, Heartbreak Ridge, Old Baldy, and Pork Chop Hill . Bloody Ridge was one of the most famous battlefields in American history .
 President Truman removed General MacArthur from command and replaced him with Ridgway in 1951 . President Truman made the controversial move in April 1951 . MacArthur was replaced as the top commander of the Army .
 The presidents action resulted from a continuing dispute between MacArthur and defense leaders in Washington as to how the Allies should conduct the war .
 MacArthur had issued public statements that there was no substitute for total victory . From the outset, MacArthur had said there were no substitute to total victory, he said .
 He said he wanted to bomb bases in Manchuria, a part of China, and use other “all-out measures’s” measures . Now he wants to use “an all-out measure’, he said .
 Truman feared such actions might lead to a third world war . Truman and his advisers feared such a war might have led to a world war in 1950s .
 Truman decided he could no longer accept MacArthur's open disagreement with national policy . Truman decided to end the war with MacArthur after MacArthur's refusal to accept his views .
 Ridgway went to Tokyo to replace MacArthur . Lieutenant General James A Van Fleet became commander of the Eighth Army .
 Allied bombers and fighter planes based in Japan, Okinawa, and South Korea roared over North Korea unopposed early in the conflict .
 Allied troops supported Allied troops, killed enemy troops, and damaged Communist bases . They supported Allied forces and killed enemy forces .
 The Soviet Union soon began to supply North Korea with MiG-15 jets, and dogfights became an important part of the war .
 Allied planes were not permitted to cross the Yalu River, and MiG-15's never flew south of the 38th parallel . All the dogfights occurred over North Korea . Allied planes never flew over the 38nd parallel .
 Most of the battles took place in “MiG Alley,” an area between the Yalu and Pyongyang . The battles were fought in the area known as MiG Alley .
 The Allies used helicopters to carry wounded soldiers from battle zones to hospitals . The Allies carried wounded soldiers to hospitals in hospitals .
 Helicopter pilots made daring rescues of Allied fliers who had been shot down . Allied pilots were able to rescue them from their own aircraft .
 The United States Air Force, Navy, and Marine Corps lost more than 2,000 planes during the war . The U.S. Air Force and Navy lost over 2,200 planes during WWII .
 Navy and Marine fliers killed about 100,000 Communist troops . Air Force and Navy fliers also killed about 184,800 Soviet troops .
 Allied naval forces included 80 destroyers, 16 aircraft carriers, 8 cruisers, and 4 battleships . The Allied naval force was the largest in the world, with the most active in Europe .
 The United States Navy helped troops land by firing shells at enemy targets on shore . The U.S. Navy fired shells at enemies on shore to help troops land .
 Wonsan, a Communist oil refining and industrial city, was under naval siege for more than two years . The city, which was under siege by the Korean peninsula, was a Communist city .
 Hopes for peace increased when Jacob Malik, the Soviet delegate to the UN, proposed a cease-fire in 1951 .
 On June 30, Ridgway, acting on instructions from Washington, suggested a meeting between Allied and Communist military officers to discuss a truce . The meeting took place on June 30 at the end of the war .
 The truce talks began July 10 at Kaesong and were moved to Panmunjom on October 25 . They are now being held at Panmunmunmunnjom in the region .
 North and South Korea agreed that the existing battle line would be the final dividing line if a truce were reached within 30 days . A settlement seemed near on November 27, when both sides agreed that a truce was reached .
 Neither side had much to gain by winning ground it might later have to surrender . This agreement had the effect of limiting combat, because neither side could win ground it later had to surrender.
 Several issues, especially voluntary repatriation of prisoners, prevented a settlement within the 30-day period .
 The UN Command had insisted that prisoners of both sides be allowed to choose whether or not they would return to their homelands . The UN had insisted both sides were allowed to decide whether to return home to their homeland .
 Many Chinese prisoners of the Allies had fought against the Communists during the Chinese civil war . Many of them had fought for the Allies in China .
 They staged a violent protest against a forced return to life under Communism . The protesters were protesting against the forced return of life under communism .
 The Communists could not agree to the UN demand without admitting that Communism had thus far failed to secure the loyalty of all its citizens . The Communist Party has not been able to secure all its loyalty from its citizens, it says .
 By late April 1952, the truce talks were firmly deadlocked over voluntary repatriation . The truce talks had been deadlocked for more than a decade .
 On October 8, the UN Command Korean War armistice line was established . North Korea and South Korea was established by July 27, 1953 . The UN Command was established in 1953 by the end of the war .
 A buffer zone, 2 } miles wide, was created along the final battle line . The area is 2.5 miles wide .
 Talks will resume when Communists are ready to offer a helpful suggestion for settling the one remaining issue, voluntary repatriation, the Communist Party says .
 General Mark W Clark replaced Ridgway as commander in chief of the U.N. Command in May 1952 . General Clark was replaced as commander of the United Nations Command in 1952 .
 Dwight D Eisenhower became president of the United States in January 1953 . Eisenhower was the first President of the U.S. to be elected to office in 1953 . He was elected to the White House in 1945 .
 After Stalin’s death, Soviet leaders began talking of the need to settle disputes peacefully . Soviet leaders later began talking about the need for peaceful resolution .
 On March 28, the Communists accepted an earlier offer by the UN Command for an exchange of sick and wounded prisoners . The Communists accepted the earlier offer on March 28 .
 The truce talks were resumed on April 26, and the Communists accepted voluntary repatriation . The Communists were repatriated from the Soviet Union .
 The Neutral Nations’ Repatriation Commission agreed to let prisoners indicate their choice . The commission was formed by representatives of Czechoslovakia, India, Poland, Sweden, and Switzerland . They agreed to allow prisoners to indicate their choices .
 An armistice agreement was signed on July 27, 1953, and the fighting ended . The fighting ended in 1953 .
 South Korea gained about 1,500 square miles (3,880 square kilometers) of territory . South Korea now has about 1.5 million square miles of territory in total .
 A Military Armistice Commission, with representatives from both sides, was set up to enforce the armistice terms . A military commission was formed to enforce those terms .
 The armistice also provided for a political conference to work out a final settlement . It provided for the end of World War II .
 Each side charged the other with torture and starvation of prisoners, and other war crimes . After the armistice was signed, each side charged each other with war crimes, including torture .
 The UN General Assembly adopted a general resolution condemning such acts of terrorism . The resolution was adopted by the General Assembly of the UN .
 1 million civilians were killed in South Korea . Property damage was estimated at more than $1 billion . About 1 million people were killed .
 Statistics were not given for civilian deaths and damage in North Korea . Statistics were also not given on civilian deaths .
 The UN Command and the Communists completed an exchange of 88,559 prisoners in September 1953 . The exchange took place between the two sides of the warring nations .
 The Neutral Nations’ Repatriation Commission took custody of prisoners who refused to return to their homelands . The Commission took control of prisoners held by the Neutral Nations .
 The armistice provided that delegates from the various countries could visit these prisoners and try to persuade them to go home . Delegates from various countries were able to visit the prisoners and persuade them home .

 The memorial includes 19 large statues of American combat troops in the Korean War . It includes a circular Pool of Remembrance, and a commemorative mural wall .
 The statues, sculpted by Frank C Gaylord I] and made of stainless steel, stand from 7 } to 7 5 feet (2. to 2. meters) tall .
 Rain gear symbolizes the Korean climate; and trudging uphill on a bed of evergreen shrubs for the rugged Korean terrain .
 Their symbolic destination is an American flag on a flagpole in the distance . The group's symbolic destination was the U.S. Capitol Hill .

 Kosciuszko, Kans ee UHS koh or kawsh CHOOSH kaw, Tadeusz, tah DEH oosh , was a Polish patriot who fought for the independence of the United States and Poland .
 He went to America in the summer of 1776, during the Revolutionary War in America . He was in America during the 1776-1776 war .
 He offered his services to the Continental Congress and was appointed engineer with the rank of colonel . He offered to the Congress and became a colonel in the ranks .
 He built fortifications near Saratoga and strengthened American defenses along the Hudson River, including those at West Point, New York .
 Congress made Kosciuszko a brigadier general after the war ended in 1783 . After the war, Congress made him a general general .
 In this struggle, he combined Poland's fight for independence with the people's struggle for social justice . Poland's independence and social justice were key issues in his life, he said .
 Defeat of the insurrection led to the third partition of Poland by Russia, Prussia, and Austria . The defeat of the uprising led to a third partition of Poland .
 Kosher, KOH shuhr, also spelled kasher, is a Hebrew word that means fit or proper . Kosher means "fit or proper" in the Hebrew .
 The word usually refers to food, but it may apply to anything considered ritually correct or acceptable according to Jewish law . The word is usually used to refer to food but may also refer to anything deemed to be acceptable .
 A witness in a trial conducted under Jewish law may be called a kosher witness . For example, a witness in such a trial may be a witness to a Jewish law .
 These laws are based on passages from the Biblical books of Leviticus and Deuteronomy . These laws were inspired by the Bible's books of the Bible .
 The laws specify that bread is kosher if it contains no forbidden fat and was not baked on the Sabbath . For example, bread is not allowed to contain any forbidden fat or to be baked on Sabbath .
 Only certain parts of acceptable animals such as cattle and sheep may be eaten . Cattle and sheep can be eaten only if they are eaten .
 The preparation of food according to Jewish dietary laws is called koshering . The preparation is known as koshering by Jewish dietary law .
 This method is designed to kill animals as quickly and painlessly as possible . The method is meant to be quick and painless . It is not the first time animals have been killed in this way .
 Before the meat is cooked, it must be drained of blood by being soaked in cold water and then salted . The meat must be salted before being cooked .
 Jews who keep a kosher home must have one set of dishes and cooking utensils for meat meals and another set for meals that include dairy products . Jews must also have two sets of dishes for meat and one for dairy dishes . Jews keep kosher homes with one set for meat .

 Vojtech Mastny Kosovo, KOH soh vol, also spelled Kosova, is a province in southern Serbia . It is one of the republics of Yugoslavia, one of Serbia's provinces .
 In the late 1990s and early 2000s, Kosovo was torn by ethnic conflict . Kosovo is now a relatively stable state of peace .
 Kosovo's natural resources include coal, lead, zinc, and many other minerals . Kosovo has a wide range of natural resources, including coal and lead .
 The Ottoman Empire ruled Kosovo from the mid1400's until 1912, when the Serbian army took control of the region . Kosovo was ruled by the Ottoman Empire until 1912 .
 In 1918, it was made part of the Kingdom of the Serbs, Croats, and Slovenes, which later became Yugoslavia . It was part of Yugoslavia's Kingdom of Serbs and Croats .
 The government limited the rights of the Albanians of Kosovo and drove thousands from their homes . Thousands of Albanians were driven from homes by the government .
 By the end of World War II in 1945, Yugoslavia had come under Communist control . Yugoslavia was at the center of the conflict in Yugoslavia .
 Kosovo was first a self-governing region and later a province of Serbia . Kosovo is now a self governing province of the Serbija region .

 Kosovo Liberation Army attacked Serbian police units in 1997 . In 1997, the group seeking independence for Kosovo attacked police units . Kosovo is now a member of NATO .
 The North Atlantic Treaty Organization tried to organize a cease-fire, but fighting continued . The North American military has been fighting in the region for years .

 NATO stopped the bombing and sent an international peacekeeping force to Kosovo . Kosovo was bombed by the U.S. in the 1990s, but the bombing was stopped .
 Tensions ran high between Serbs and Albanians in the province . Many refugees returned, but tensions ran high . Many Serbs returned to Serbia .
 Despite the presence of peacekeepers, the tension frequently erupted into violence . The tension frequently erupts into violence between the two sides .
 Serbs boycotted the first local elections since the end of the war in 2000, and the Yugoslav government refused to recognize the results . In 2000, Serbs refused to vote in local elections in Yugoslavia, and refused to accept the result .
 Kossuth, KAHS ooth or KAW shut, Lajos, LAH yawsh, is a Hungarian national hero . He led the unsuccessful Hungarian rebellion of 1848-1849 .
 In 1825, Kossuth entered parliament, where he led a movement for liberal government reform . He was a member of the British House of Representatives . He died in 1825 .
 When uprisings broke out in the Austrian Empire in 1848, the Hungarians, led by Kossuth, also revolted . The Hungarians were the first to revolt in Austria's Austrian Empire .

 Klan members wear robes and hoads, and burn crosses at outdoor meetings . Klan members burn crosses, burn them at outdoor meeting . KKK members are dressed in robes, and robes, as they burn crosses .
 The KKK was formed as a social club by a group of Confederate Army veterans in Pulaski, Tenn., in 1865 or 1866 . The group was formed by Confederate soldiers and women .

 The group took its name from the Greek word kyk/os, meaning circle, and the English word clan . The group was formed from a circle of circle and clan .
 Klan members terrorized blacks to keep them from voting or exercising the other rights they had gained during Reconstruction . Klan members believed in the superiority of whites and believed in their superiority .
 The Klan threatened, beat, and murdered many blacks and their white sympathizers in the South . Many blacks and whites were killed by the Klan in the Southerners .
 To hide their identity, Klan terrorists wore robes and hoods, draped sheets over their horses, and rode at night . Klan terrorists used to wear robes, hoods and robes to hide identity .
 The KKK spread rapidly throughout the Southern United States and became known as the Invisible Empire . The Invisible Empire spread rapidly through the Southern U.S. The KKK was known for its rapid growth in the South .
 In 1871, Congress passed the Force Bill, which gave the President the authority to use federal troops against the Klan .
 The Klan directed its activities against groups it considered un-American, including blacks, immigrants, Jews, and Roman Catholics . The Klan was active in the 1930s and '40s .
 The KKK grew rapidly and by the mid-1920's had more than 2 million members throughout the country . The KKK was founded in the 1920s and grew rapidly in the U.S. The KKK had over 1 million members .
 Some Klan members burned crosses and whipped, tortured, and murdered people whose activities angered them . Most relied on peaceful means, including burning crosses and whipping crosses .

 Public criticism of Klan violence and quarrels among Klan leaders weakened the organization . However, public criticism of the Klan violence weakened the Klan .
 Green died in 1949, and the Klan split into many competing groups . The Klan then split into other groups, including the KKK .

 Simon Kuznets, Simon, won the 1971 Nobel Prize in economics . He was an American economist who won the Nobel Prize for economics .
 He did important studies of national income, economic cycles, and modern economic growth . He also studied national income and economic cycles .
 Kuznets laid the foundation for modern national income accounting in his National Income and Its Composition, 1919-38 and other works .
 He found evidence of recurring cycles of economic growth that are 15 to 20 years long . He also found evidence that economic cycles are 15-20 years long, he says .
 Kuznets studied capital formation, population change, industrial structure, and how invention, innovation, and scientific advancement lead to economic growth .
 He also identified a pattern called the inverted U hypothesis or Kuznets hypothesis . Kuznetnets hypothesis is the name of a pattern known as inverted U .
 This pattern consists of a trend away from, and then toward, equal distribution of income over the course of economic growth . This pattern is seen in the U.S. economy .
 Kuznets was born in Kharkov, Ukraine (then part of the Russian Empire), but spent all of his adult life in the United States . Kuznetnets is a noted author .
 Kwakiutl Indians live on the northwest coast of North America . Kwakiutsi live on northwest coast .
 The Kwakiutl hold these ceremonies to celebrate weddings and other social events . The ceremonies are held in honor of weddings and social events held by the people .
 Chiefs sponsor potlatches, at which huge quantities of valuable property are displayed, given away to guests, and occasionally destroyed . Chiefs sponsor potslatches at which they display valuable property .
 Acceptance of the gifts symbolizes recognition of the prestige and social rank of the sponsoring chief and the chiefs family . Acceptance is a symbol of respect for the prestige of the sponsor and the chief family .
 Traditionally, the Kwakiutl made their living by fishing, hunting, and by gathering clams, berries, seaweed, and other foods .
 They lived in villages of plank houses along beaches on what is now Vancouver Island and the mainland of British Columbia in Canada .
 Many family groups placed totem poles in front of their homes and elsewhere to signify their ancestry and social rank . The poles were placed by family groups to signify social rank and ancestry .
 Today, over 6,000 Kwakiutl live mainly on small reserves in their traditional homeland or nearby in Canadian and US cities . Today, they live mainly in Canada and the United States .
 Robert S Grumet Kwanzaa, KWAHN zuh, is an Afro-American holiday based on the traditional African festival of the harvest .
 The word Kwanzaa comes from a phrase which means first fruits in Swahili, an East African language . The word "Kwanza" is sometimes spelled Kwanzza, or "first fruits" in the name of the first fruits .
 The holiday was developed in 1966 in the United States by Maulana Karenga, a professor of Pan-African studies and black cultural leader . The holiday is celebrated by African Americans .
 It combines traditional African practices with Afro-American aspirations and ideals . The project is based on African practices and aspirations of the American people .
 The holiday centers around the Nguzo Saba, seven principles of black culture that were developed by Karenga . The holiday is based on the seven principles developed by the African-American leader .
 Near the end of the holiday, the community gathers for a feast called karamu . The feast is a traditional feast known as a feast for the community .
 A typical karamu features traditional African food, ceremonies honoring the ancestors, assessments of the old year and commitments for the new, performances, music, and dancing .
 Maulana Karenga Kwashiorkor, KWAH shee awe kawr, is a disease caused by a severe lack of complete protein . The disease is caused by the absence of a complete protein protein .
 Only complete protein has the nine amino acids that the body either cannot make, or cannot make sufficient amounts . The body cannot make enough amino acids to produce complete protein .
 Kwashiorkor occurs mostly in developing nations whose people lack foods high enough in complete protein . Kwashiorksor occurs in developing countries where people lack food high enough to eat .
 It generally strikes children from 1 to 3 years old, and it can be fatal . It can also be fatal for children from the age of 1-3 .
 Young children need large amounts of complete protein for growth and various body functions . The protein is essential for many of the body's functions and growth .
 Many mothers breast-feed their babies for two years in addition to feeding them solid foods . Many mothers continue breast-feeding their babies until they are two years old . Breast-feeding mothers continue to feed their babies with solid foods for two more years .
 The amount is generally small and protects against deficiency only if the basic diet is reasonably adequate . But the amount is not small and should be kept in mind .
 In many cases, the child then eats only starchy, low-protein foods and kwashiorkor is likely to occur . The child is then likely to eat low-fat, starchy foods .
 In severe cases, the muscles waste away, and the skin swells with body fluids . The muscle waste away and the body swells in severe cases .
 The child becomes extremely listless and resents any kind of disturbance, even feeding . The child's condition is often described as a severe reaction to any disturbance .
 As the disease progresses, the skin loses its natural color and may develop dark patches . The skin may also become dark patches as it progresses .
 Kwashiorkor also damages the liver and the small intestine . It may also cause black hair to turn reddish-brown .
 Treatment generally consists of supplementing the diet with dried skim milk and other high-protein foods . Treatment generally involves supplements of high- protein foods .
 Antibiotics are often given because kwashiorkor lowers a child’s resistance to infection . Antibiotic is often given to children who have a low resistance to infections . The drug is thought to be effective in reducing the risk of infection .
 Many children who survive kwashiorkor do not reach their potential physical growth . Many children in the orphanage do not live up to their potential potential .
 It occurs as long flat bands of crystals, and its surface varies in hardness . The surface of this crystal varies from hardness to hardness .

 John Butler Kyd, kihd, Thomas , was an English playwright . He greatly influenced the development of Elizabethan drama .
 In The Spanish Tragedy, Kyd created a new style of drama by blending elements of classical Roman tragedy with the lively but crude popular drama of his day .
 He based this form on that of the revenge play, which was developed by Seneca, a Roman philosopher and dramatist .
 The Spanish Tragedy is the story of a nobleman’s revenge for his murdered son . The story follows the murder of his son in Spain .
 In the drama, Kyd also used such classical elements as a ghost, much bloodshed and violence, and formal poetic language . In the play, the main character is played by a ghost .

 Kyrgyzstan, kihr guh STAHN or KIHR guh sTAnn, is a mountainous country in central Asia . The country is known for its mountainous terrain .
 Kyrgyzstan became an independent country in 1991, after about 70 years as part of the Soviet Union . The official language is Kyrgyzh, the national language of KyrgyZ .
 Kyrgyzstan's president is the country’s most powerful government official . A president serves as head of state and is the most powerful official in the country .
 A prime minister and a cabinet of ministers run the daily operations of the government . The prime minister is in charge of the country's daily operations .
 President appoints prime minister, who then appoints cabinet of ministers . The president appoints the prime minister . The cabinet is then appointed by the president .
 The Assembly of People’s Representation has 70 members . It consists of the Legislative Assembly, which has 35 members, and the Assembly of 35 .
 Slightly more than half of Kyrgyzstan’s people belong to the Kyrgygyz ethnic group . The country is home to one of the largest cities in the country's history .
 Most of the ethnic Kyrgyz live in rural areas and live by herding and farming . Most of them are herding, farming and herding .
 They speak Russian, live mainly in urban areas, and hold most of the country’s industrial and technical jobs . Most of the Russian population speak Russian and live mainly urban areas .

 Kyrgyz clan includes all people who are descended from a common ancestor through their father’s side of the family . Kyrgygyz clans include all people descended from common ancestors through their fathers' side .

 They hold most of the country’s regional and national government offices . They are also in charge of the national and regional government offices.

 These people live in portable, tentlike yurts, made of a round wooden frame covered with felt . They are made up of a wooden frame made of felt .

 Livestock raising is Kyrgyzstan's chief agricultural activity . Sheep are the nation’s most important kind of livestock . sheep are the most important type of livestock in the country .

 Beginning in about the 700’s, Turkic tribes began to move into the region . The region was largely populated by people from around 600 years ago .

 Kyrgyzstan remained primarily under the domination of Mongol peoples until 1758, when China gained control of the region .
 The Chinese maintained loose rule over the Kyrgyz until the 1830's, when the oppressive Khanate of Quqon conquered the people . The Chinese maintain loose rule until the 18th century, when they conquered the country .
 The Russian Empire began to expand into central Asia in the mid-1800’s . The Empire began expanding into the region in the 1800s .
 It defeated the Khanate of Qugon in 1876 and made the region a Russian province . The region was made a Russian Province in the early years of the Russian Empire .

 The Bolsheviks seized control of the Russian government in 1917 . They were known as the Bolsheviks .
 The Soviet Union was formed in 1922 under Russian Communist leadership . It was formed under the leadership of the Soviet Union .
 In 1924, the Soviets made Kyrgyzstan an autonomous oblast (self-governing region) of the Soviet Union called the KaraKyrgyz Autonomous Oblast . The region was made an autonomous region of the USSR in 1924 .
 In 1936, Kyrgyz Soviet Socialist Republic became a republic . In the 1940s, the region became a Soviet republic . Kyrgygyz is now a republic called the Kyrgygz Soviet Republic .
 The Soviet Union established a powerful Communist government and took control of all industry and land in the country . The country was ruled by the Soviet Union in the 1950s .
 For hundreds of years, large numbers of rural Kyrgyz had been nomadic herders . They raised livestock in mountain valleys in the summer and moved them to the foothills in winter .

 During the upheaval, Kyrgyzstan and several other republics declared their independence . The country then declared its own independence from Russia .

 Kyzylkum, kuh Z/HL KOOM, is a desert that lies in southern Kazakhstan and northern Uzbekistan in central Asia . The desert is known as the "Kazakhan desert"
 It covers about 88,000 square miles between the Syr Darya and Amu Darya rivers . The region is southeast of the Aral Sea . It covers 88,00 square miles .
 Other sections, such as the northern Syr Darya River plains and the eastern upland fringes, have been irrigated so that farmers can raise crops .
